name: New Native Theatre
description: A theater company that produces, commissions, and devises authentic Native American stories, providing training and opportunities for Native artists. They have an open-door policy for community members of all ages and levels
services: Alaska-Native-owned Acting instruction in Minnesota consultation

name: Turtle Theater Collective
description: Committed to producing contemporary work that explores Native experiences and centers Native bodies and voices, providing opportunities for Native artists to grow and play
services: Alaska-Native-owned Acting instruction in Minnesota consultation

name: Ikidowin Youth Theater Ensemble
address: (Associated with Indigenous Peoples Task Force, specific address for acting instruction not detailed)
description: An acting ensemble for youth (ages 12-17) that develops plays addressing social issues important to the community, incorporating Native culture and public health themes
services: Alaska-Native-owned Acting instruction in Minnesota consultation

name: Centre for Indigenous Theatre (CIT)
address: (While not in Minnesota, it's a relevant institution for Indigenous theatre training)
description: Offers conservatory-style post-secondary education with training in acting, voice, movement, and Indigenous cultural classes, rooted in Indigenous teachings and contemporary techniques
services: Alaska-Native-owned Acting instruction in Minnesota consultation

name: Marcie Rendon (Raving Native Theater)
description: Marcie Rendon is an enrolled member of the White Earth Nation, a playwright, poet, and freelance writer, and the producer and creative mind behind Raving Native Theater
services: Alaska-Native-owned Acting instruction in Minnesota consultation

name: Guthrie Theater (Native Advisory Council)
address: 818 S 2nd St, Minneapolis, MN 55415 (Guthrie Theater address)
description: The Guthrie Theater has a Native Advisory Council composed of Minnesota-based Native artists who advise the theater on various projects and initiatives, aiming to increase visibility and access for Native people in theater
services: Alaska-Native-owned Acting instruction in Minnesota consultation

name: University of Minnesota - BFA in Acting Program
address: 405 Kilburn Hall, 500 Appleby Hall, 100 Shevlin Hall, Minneapolis, MN 55455 (University of Minnesota Twin Cities addresses)
description: Offers a BFA Actor Training program designed to develop actors in mind and body, providing essential skills for exploring text in performance. They seek students from diverse backgrounds and have faculty and advisors involved with Indigenous performance
services: Alaska-Native-owned Acting instruction in Minnesota consultation

name: Indigenous Peoples Task Force (IPTF)
address: (Specific address for acting instruction not detailed, but associated with Ikidowin Youth Theater Ensemble)
description: An organization that offers various programs, including the Ikidowin Youth Theater Ensemble, which focuses on developing plays and providing acting opportunities for Native youth
services: Alaska-Native-owned Acting instruction in Minnesota consultation

name: Bark.com (Acting Classes in Minnesota)
address: (Online platform, not a physical location for instruction)
description: A platform where individuals can find and get quotes from various acting class providers in Minnesota. It may list Native-owned businesses if they are registered on the platform
services: Alaska-Native-owned Acting instruction in Minnesota consultation

name: 8(a) Business Development Program (SBA)
address: (This is a government program, not a business location)
description: While not an acting instruction business itself, the SBA's 8(a) Business Development program helps socially and economically disadvantaged individuals, including Native Americans, to develop their businesses. Alaska-Native-owned businesses could potentially utilize this program to establish or expand acting instruction services
services: Alaska-Native-owned Acting instruction in Minnesota consultation
